About Me

Built 7+ games. Led teams. Survived broken ones. Published solo projects, won awards, rewrote legacy code... and then I turned 16.

What started as game development became a deeper obsession with systems: how things work, how they fail, and how to make them better. I've focused on building complex weapon systems, AI behaviors, and gameplay mechanics that feel alive — and I'm now pivoting into backend development and automation, chasing stability, scale, and the elegance of clean infrastructure.

I’ve worked solo and in teams. I've dealt with deadlines, disasters, and the strange silence of code that should work but doesn’t. I know what it's like to carry a project when no one else will. I know how to build momentum from zero. And I know how to ship.
I'm not here to follow a script — I’m here to solve problems. To learn fast. To adapt faster. To build things that matter.

I don’t have all the answers. But I know how to find them.
